properties.title: Walser museum
properties.abstract: This important local history collection provides a genuine living insight into the life and history of the Walser community.
properties.description:
The local history museum in Triesenberg provides information on the culture and traditions of the Liechtenstein Walser. It offers a good overview of the region’s settlement history and the effects of the immigration of the Walser from Wallis (Valais) from the 14th century.

A highlight of the exhibition is the reconstruction of the dairy room and living room of an old Steg Maiensässhütte (Alpine hut) from around 1900. The "Triesenberg” multivision show is a real treat for the eyes and ears. Lasting approx. 25 minutes, it presents the life and history of the mountain community with an impressive cross-fade projection on three large screens. The show is available in four languages and is a recommended way to begin your museum visit.
